title: Prelude in E Minor, Op. 28 No. 4

musicalLanguage.description: A masterpiece of economy — a simple, descending melody over slowly shifting chords creates profound sadness. Reportedly played at Chopin's own funeral.
musicalLanguage.structure: Through-composed: continuous descending motion with final cadence
keyMoments: Opening: the melody barely moves while harmony shifts beneath
Final measures: cadence resolves the tension
teachingGoals: Dynamic shaping over a long phrase
styleTips: Let the harmonies breathe — no rushing
